title: EastEnders spoilers: Jean struggles to cope with Daniel's death tonight
text:
It’s been an incredibly tough year for Jean Slater (Gillian Wright) in EastEnders — what with her ongoing cancer battle coupled with the fact that daughter Stacey Fowler (Lacey Turner) had to go on the run after she left Phil Mitchell (Steve McFadden) for dead — but she was left further heartbroken in last night’s episode when she discovered that new pal Daniel (Adrian Edmondson) had died, and tonight, she struggles to cope as a result.

After their first meeting during a chemotherapy session, Daniel wasted little time in getting on Jean’s nerves. However, over time they managed to put their differences aside, and — as they did so — they ended up becoming rather close. The last couple of months have seen the two bond, and they’ve spent quite a bit of time in each other’s company — and even shared a kiss last week.

Last night, viewers saw Jean looking forward, and — with Martin (James Bye) having returned home — she was hopeful that Stacey would return to the Square soon so that she could inform her about her burgeoning romance with Daniel. However, her world came crashing down moments later when she received a call from Daniel’s neighbour to inform her that Daniel had passed away.

Advertisement

Advertisement

After some persuasion, Kush (Davood Ghadami) managed to convince Jean that — in spite of the short amount of time they knew one another — it was all right for her to mourn his loss, as he clearly meant a great deal to her. In tonight’s episode, Kush accompanies Jean as she attends a memorial service for Daniel — which is hosted by his neighbour Mike.

It’s set to be an incredibly emotional event, as she struggles to come to terms with the loss of her close friend.

Emotions will certainly be running high for Jean, but how will she cope without Daniel?

She could certainly use support from Stacey right now, that’s for sure.

EastEnders continues on Friday 11th October at 8pm on BBC One.

Advertisement Advertisement
description: Daniel's death has a huge impact on Jean
